title: Deterministic Even-Cycle Detection in Broadcast CONGEST
authors: Pierre Fraigniaud, Ma\"el Luce, Fr\'ed\'eric Magniez and Ioan Todinca
abstract:
We show that, for every $k\geq 2$, $C_{2k}$-freeness can be decided in
$O(n^{1-1/k})$ rounds in the Broadcast CONGEST model, by a deterministic
algorithm. This (deterministic) round-complexity is optimal for $k=2$ up to
logarithmic factors thanks to the lower bound for $C_4$-freeness by Drucker et
al. [PODC 2014], which holds even for randomized algorithms. Moreover it
matches the round-complexity of the best known randomized algorithms by
Censor-Hillel et al. [DISC 2020] for $k\in\{3,4,5\}$, and by Fraigniaud et al.
[PODC 2024] for $k\geq 6$. Our algorithm uses parallel BFS-explorations with
deterministic selections of the set of paths that are forwarded at each round,
in a way similar to what was done for the detection of odd-length cycles, by
Korhonen and Rybicki [OPODIS 2017]. However, the key element in the design and
analysis of our algorithm is a new combinatorial result bounding the "local
density" of graphs without $2k$-cycles, which we believe is interesting on its
own.
subjects: Computer Science/Distributed, Parallel, and Cluster Computing
